content: I got a report that one of the downsides of Docker is that you can no longer see server.log in Netbeans.
But that means that formerly you started Payara with Netbeans. IntelliJ can start Docker containers AFAIK. Maybe Netbeans can, too?
On the other hand: I always have a terminal running in parallel...

Maybe. I'm aware that Netbeans can show server.log but I personally always had a terminal up on the side. I'm just trying to listen to the feedback. Maybe stuff like this means the difference between adopting Docker or not.
Sure! On the other hand: if this the kind of problem which keeps people from using Docker... Sounds like we're talkin' first world problems :wink:
